column2: 13-18 Male  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$My son was prescribed this in Oct'16. He has been wetting the bed 90% of nights since birth. He took it for 16 months - he started at 25mg for about 6-8 months
column3: then increased to 50mg when he had the occasional wet night. This had completely changed his life. Since starting imipramine
column4: he has had maybe 5 or 6 wet nights. That's in the last year and a half. He is DDAVP resistant and this was the answer for him. I didn't find it changed his personality much. If anything
column5: he seemed a bit more focused and calm but nothing substantial.

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient) $5$5$5$No dreams post medications at night so you kinda wake up blanked out - helps control asthma while sleeping.
65-74 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"Watching my son go through a losing
column3: horrific battle with ALS caused an inability to sleep. (My mom passed away exactly a year later.) Trying to focus at work was impossible. REM sleep was non-existent. My psychiatrist rx'ed Lunesta
column4: Ambien CR
column5: & a host of other sleep aids...nothing worked. When I finally opted to see another psychiatrist as an inpatient
column6: he rx'ed imipramine. I started out @ 25 mg.
column7: which had no effect. The doctor gave me an additional 25 mg. each nite until I reached 100 mg. I cannot express what it was like to finally sleep
column8: really sleep. I still remember having my 1st dream in years! This psychiatrist had been a doctor in Viet Nam
column9: & had prescribed imipramine to all pilots in order for them to get a good night's sleep & wake up refreshed. There is no ""hangover"" effect with this medication. I truly feel that it saved my sanity

column2: 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$3$2$By far imipramine has the harshest side effect profile of all the tricyclic antidepressants (trimipramine runs a close second). It's a shame because imipramine works very well. I took it only at bedtime
column3: as an adjunct to my 3x/day Xanax for panic attacks
column4: but man -- throughout the following day dizziness
column5: blurred vision
column6: heart flutters & sticky mouth was
column7: oh man
column8: strong. Also had this other weird side effect
column9: felt like my penis was being pinched & strangulated. Very harsh side effects. Yes
column10: all the tricyclics have the same set of side effects
column11: but it's usually not so noticeable at low
column12: therapeutic doses. I much prefer nortryptiline (Pamelor) which works every bit as good for anxiety
column13: preventing panic attacks and general depression
column14: but the side effects aren't nearly as prominent as imipramine's. In fact I'd be surprised if imipramine is even prescribed anymore.

14$Condition: Other$1/21/2014 4:33:35 PM$Reviewer: Happy Old Man, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $5$5$5$In my 74th year I have suffered for over 35 years with epigastric pain. I formerly had a resection of lower colon for diverticulosis in 1994. I suffered from debilitation abdominal pain almost ecvery day. By chance
column2: a friend was taking this drug for depression and offered me a pill at bed time and said it will make ""Me sleep better.""  Why not? I thought it was a sleeping pill.  I went to bed and the next day my epgastric pain was gone
column3: bowel sounds galore and things started to move in digestion. No longer have constipation or the opposite or abdominal pain.

column2: I am not depressed at all
column3: have a great life as a retired professional
column4: have a boat
column5: many homes
column6: cars  and doing just fine. I had MRIs cat scans
column7: barium swallows etc. etc. and they found nothing. I short
column8: I have my life back. The only down side is that I wake up early (4AM)sometimes and feel a tad tired in the late afternoon.

column1: This help  may be anecdotal as to me
column2: but it cured a problem no doctor could cure and it was just by chance. I notice no side effects other then an earlier rise then usual which is 5:30 AM.I take 10 mg and sometimes cut them in half (5mg)  or skip a day or two. Amazing luck . As an aside
column3: i got a warning   letter in the mail about this drug. As a old cynic watching the money cycle in drug companies
column4: I think the drug companies sent this out to get you on  a more expensive anti-depressent. (that is its primary use I am told). This drug is cheap and I guess their monopoly on it has expired. Big Pharma's motto is ""Make as much as you can as fast as you can.""  You be the judge."

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$"After being diagnosed with Panic Disorder in 2005 and going on to develop Agoraphobia years later I first went to my primary care and he prescribed me Effexor for 2 years which didn't really control the severity of my attacks.  I was then put on Paxil and had to discontinue from a bad side effect and then finally Lexapro which I took for 2 years.  It helped some but gave me nightmares and taking it before bed kept me up all night for those 2 years which was horrible!  I was then recommended to see a Psychiatrist last year for my condition which was getting worse and I was having between 30-40 panic attacks a day (yes that's not a typo unfortunately).  I was miserable
column3: had to quit college
column4: work and could barely function even at home!  Had attacks even if I stayed home and avoided my triggers (driving
column5: going into stores or malls
column6: large buildings
column7: church and even in the shower)
column8: my life had come to a screeching halt and I had no desire to live anymore and felt I had no purpose in living!  Well
column9: now I've been on Imipramine for 11 months and it has turned my life around and I credit this med for saving my life and the Dr who put me on it of course!!!  There are the side effects like dry mouth
column16: etc. but after a few months of slowing upping my dose my body has become use to the drug and all I can see now is how I am almost a different person and have much fewer
column18: easier to handle panic attacks when I do have them which depends on my stress level now.  I maybe have 1 a week or less and depend much less on taking my Xanex with the 3-4 .25 mg a day before! I have gone 2-3 weeks without the Xanex now and have recently hit my highest dose of Imipramine at 100mg and that seems to work best for me. For those of you who suffer from terrifying Panic Disorder and are not getting any relief
column19: try this...I have reacted amazingly well to this and I hope you do too!  DON""T GIVE UP!!!!"

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$3$"Imipramine was prescribed as last resort for me  when I suffered cystitis-like symptoms which often left me immobilised after urninating...I could not walk! column3: however the side-effects
column4: the dreadful dry mouth
column5: the sluggish mental ability and hoarse voice
column6: has forced me now in to recently giving up the medication. Almost immediately I have returned to a clear-thinking individual; I have rediscovered my vocabulary; my voice sounds less hoarse as the vocal tract is not dried out and most importantly of all...so far...I have not had a cystitis flare-up. I was on 75mg per night and started at 25mg per week building up over three weeks before I gained physical benefit from the medication. I have maintained this level of medication occasionally increasing it
column7: when high levels of stressful episodes were imminent.

column1: Throughout this I have taken laxatives to maintain a bowel movement.

column2: but used with intelligence. It has side-effects which at times I thought were worse than the condition...it is a medication which has very personal side effects and it needs a user to monitor well-being versus side  effects...whatever they may be. Don't dismiss it because of the side-effects but don't let the side effects take over your life either.       "
